page.title: 14 BIRDS
page.content: There are no rare species of birds present in this area but there are species which are affected by human disturbance.The majority of birds are found in the field and woodland zones. Yellow hammer and the common members of the finch family often come to gardens in the winter.Nuthatch,tree creeper,goldcrest and the common species of tits live in the woods along with green and great spotted woodpeckers. In summer chiffchaff, blackcap,willow and garden warblers are common in the woods along with a few wood warblers. Dipper,kingfisher and grey wagtail are resident on the river with common sandpiper in spring and autumn.Buzzard sparrowhawk and kestrel hunt and nest in this area. In winter redwing and fieldfare join the common thrushes in the parks and gardens.
